question: Does genetic deficiency of FGF21 exacerbate atherosclerotic plaque formation in apolipoprotein E-deficient mice? Answer with Yes or No.

content.source_1: FGF21 deficiency causes a marked exacerbation of atherosclerotic plaque formation and premature death in apolipoprotein E(-/-) mice, which is accompanied by hypoadiponectinemia and severe hypercholesterolemia.
content.source_2: In apolipoprotein E(-/-) mice, chronic recombinant FGF21 administration did not prevent atherosclerosis; vascular neointima and macrophage inflammatory markers increased, while hepatic sterol regulatory element-binding protein-2 expression was upregulated, resulting in greater cholesterol synthesis and worsening hypercholesterolemia.
content.source_3: Contrary to the proposed multiorgan model, FGF21 showed no atheroprotective effect: modulation of liver–adipose–vascular crosstalk was not detected, and plaque burden remained unchanged relative to controls.
